njvG99UoUoOs2Ysq1hCvpw.text: I admit I love this kind of places...Am I a hipster?   Anyway, it's a cosy place with a nice (rustic and modern) decoration and with lovely staff!  Located in a great place, in front of St. Giles Cathedral, you can take a rest from the rain or just have a late brunch.  Really great capuccino (comes with a draw like flower on the cream, super cute) and croissant (french style) that comes with butter and jam. Price is reasonable for the city.

Vzssv51ZTh3ectFs-oz8yA.text: We were confused at first because some of the pics were of a different place called St Giles Cafe and Bar. Anyway, we found this one, we had just missed breakfast (ends at 11:15) which was fine because what we had, we liked and the guy helping us couldn't have been nicer. Give this place a try if you are looking for something quick, simple and imo good. The florentine was good, I wanted to try the brownie but didn't get a chance, its right behind the cathedral off the royal mile.

photos.caption: Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetable quiche, potato salad and cole slaw was all delicious.
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Entrance behind the cathedral.

bRmIKPrln1_m-Y3UrHg30g.text: Cutest little spot! We stopped here just after seeing the Edinburgh Castle. Wonderful salad, soup, coffee, and hummus appetizer. Awesomely cozy lunch spot

photos.caption: Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

v_V37yjOVFdGWvQoAZkbqQ.text: Very charming, warm and friendly cafe near St.Giles Cathedral (but not full of tourists!). The chocolate brownie was delicious and rich - thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ZnndH0ovhilG58f1DLSA0w.text: All the reviews on here are for St Giles Cafe Bar, which is not the same as St Giles Cathedral Cafe. The Cathedral Cafe is a cafe in the basement of the cathedral. The Cathedral Cafe helps fund the Cathedral, and I love this idea. But don't go to the wrong place if you're expecting the other cafe. You'll be confused and highly disappointed. If you're not picky about your food and are just wanting a quick lunch or breakfast, then the Cathedral cafe would be just fine.

2cLfGCR6e8ZwZituI0fGLQ.text: Nice recommendation from our hotel. This place is very conveniently located off of the Royal Mile. I tried their signature waffle which is served with streaky bacon, syrup, and brie. This combination turned out very good! The creamy Brie with the salty bacon and sweet syrup on he fluffy/crisp waffle was exactly what I needed. Their cappuccinos weren't bad, though a little more wet than I'm used to. The service was prompt and friendly. The atmosphere was typical for a busy morning breakfast hotspot. Light, bright, and quick to turn over. I wouldn't mind coming back due to their convenient location, good food, and decent prices.

photos.caption: Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. St. Giles Waffle
Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetable quiche

1Ek57j26RMFoU61HlRJiZQ.text: I had delicious soup here on this last visit. It's a nice, relaxing place, with friendly attentive staff and a very handy location- just off the royal mile, and somehow manages to slightly sidestep the craziness (especially with the fringe on).   I'll go back again soon :)

w6zxC0fkEiWO5TOiuTwwSQ.text: Just a few meters from the Royal Mile, we found this great cafe. The special of the day was tomato/basil soup and ham/cheese croissant, which were wonderful.  Service was excellent.

bc98HBsrspg79uHA3KoJoA.text: I really did not want to eat here once I saw the menu. I ordered the waffle, tomato basil soup,  and the quiche for my family. I will have to say amazing!!! Everything was delicious!! The quiche was the best quiche I have ever had. Please eat here and enjoy.

ZK3aN5d3e_nKkd_ujAV2cg.text: Great service, and delicious food! I had the croissant with ham & cheese, which, to my surprise, came served in a full dish with salad on the side, like a regular lunch course.   For dessert I tried their chocolatiest treat: Chocolate ganache cake. Delicious and SO chocolatey!! My boyfriend had the waffle with nutella and I have to admit I stole about half of it. delicious waffle!!!   At the end, I went upstairs for the bathroom, and saw that the best seats are actually on the top floor! With a bird's eye view on the Royal mile, you can people watch from just about any comfy seat (it's armchairs-only upstairs!!) thanks to well-placed mirrors. Lovely!!

photos.caption: Photo of St Giles' Cathedral Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

kBaVS8GGz_eTnnZRb8WTVQ.text: Stopped in to the Cafe for a coffee today, it serves a good variety of snacks soup & some meals too. Not the cheapest but apleasant experince. The coffee was freshly made & very nice indeed. We just had to have a little something to go with it. Greame opted for the carrot cake, a thing of beauty! I had a bit of millionaires shortbread and my parents shared a piece of tiffin, not a crumb was left. The only problem with this place is the accoustics. There was a large table in the corner who were speaking rather loudly & it echoed round the place!No soft furnishing to absorb the noise!That said I would return! The staff were really nice

AcMpBHFeHEPb0svz5sbn0Q.text: I visited Edinburgh in February 09 and found this cafe after a cold morning sight-seeing. It has such a warm & cosy atmosphere in the winter, lovely to just sit, chat, drink tea and eat cake. Inside it is dimly lit which it gives it a calm and laid back vibe, the staff are young and attentive, the ceiling is high and offers interesting views from whatever place you are sat, check out upstairs (where the loos are) its a lighter, brighter space with sofas and big mirrors and a great view. St Giles Cafe is a much better alternative to the chain coffee shops.
